headline: ScentMatch™ Expands Into Select Walmart Stores Nationwide with High-End Fragrance Wax Melts That Deliver Luxury for Less
summary: ScentMatch, the new home fragrance disruptor inspired by Gen Z's love of viral scents and everyday indulgence, is officially hitting shelves in select Walmart stores nationwide—bringing premium, high-end fragrance experiences to everyday spaces, starting at just $3.96.

headline: Grocery e-commerce sales jump nearly 30% in June
summary: Delivery, pickup and ship-to-home all reported year-over-year sales gains of at least 25% as Walmart continues to threaten supermarkets, Brick Meets Click found.

headline: Piper Sandler downgrades Best Buy on weak appliance sales
summary: Investing.com -- Piper Sandler downgraded Best Buy Co (NYSE:BBY). to Neutral from Overweight and cut its price target to $75, warning that the U.S. electronics retailer is unlikely to deliver meaningful growth in the coming quarters as appliance and TV sales continue to lag.

raw.headline: Piper Sandler downgrades Best Buy on weak appliance sales
raw.summary: Investing.com -- Piper Sandler downgraded Best Buy Co (NYSE:BBY). to Neutral from Overweight and cut its price target to $75, warning that the U.S. electronics retailer is unlikely to deliver meaningful growth in the coming quarters as appliance and TV sales continue to lag.

headline: JAMS LAUNCHES NATIONALLY IN WALMART, BRINGING A FRESH TAKE ON THE CLASSIC PB&J TO STORES ACROSS AMERICA
summary: Today, the revolutionary reinvention of the classic peanut butter and jelly sandwich, Jams has officially announced its exclusive nationwide launch in partnership with leading retailer Walmart. The protein packed and health-forward snack will roll out in over 3,000+ stores across the United States starting on Monday, July 14th. Created by Nashville based consumer products house The DropOut Companies, Jams delivers everything you love about a PB&J, without the weird ingredients.

headline: Mexico retailers poised for Q2 bump despite inflation rebound
summary: MEXICO CITY (Reuters) -Mexican retailers are expected to post solid second-quarter 2025 results, boosted by favorable calendar effects, though global economic risks and sticky inflation present challenges for brands in the year's second half, analysts told Reuters.  Favorable calendar effects have made analysts more optimistic about the quarter.  Walmex has already announced record in-store and online sales during Mexico's Hot Sale, a nine-day promotional period that began in late May. An LSEG poll of analysts forecast Walmex will post a 9% revenue and 5% profit jump from a year earlier.

Walmex has already announced record in-store and online sales during Mexico's Hot Sale, a nine-day promotional period that began in late May. An LSEG poll of analysts forecast Walmex will post a 9% revenue and 5% profit jump from a year earlier.

headline: Bitcoin’s Mysterious Creator Is (Almost) the World’s 10th Richest Person
summary: Satoshi's wallet, which made all its holdings from mining the network in its earliest days, has remained untouched since 2010, when it was run on a few laptops.

headline: Similar to Los Alamos in 1940s, Los Lunas getting transformed by tech
summary: LOS LUNAS — Power poles are popping up like daisies in spring. Once a sleepy community of commuters, Los Lunas has in recent decades seen an influx of residents and, with them, more housing, a surge in industry and a groundbreaking on a new hospital last year — all while New Mexico’s population has remained largely stagnant. The community landed a whale in 2016, when Meta announced plans to ...
